intro: Epilobium arvernense, commonly known as the Arvernian willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that are typically arranged in racemes, blooming from June to August. Epilobium arvernense is often found in moist habitats such as riverbanks, meadows, and woodland edges. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
